p: Water is the most polar solvent compared to all the other solvents used, and its extraction spectrum contains the most polar biomolecules such as carbohydrates and other saponins that are not well extracted by other polar solvents such as methanol and ethanol [ 35]. Saponins are a structurally diverse family of plant secondary metabolites that possess the ability to haemolyse erythrocytes. Since saponins are polar compounds, the extraction methods use water, aqueous methanol or ethanol, absolute ethanol, methanol, or n-butanol [ 36]. The type of sugar moiety and functional group attached to a sugar moiety and the concentration of saponin influence the ability of the saponin to dissolve in different solvents, and also different extracts exert different activities [ 37].
